reviews.text: Super nice and funny. Basically his whole AP Spanish class is discussing things in Spanish and learning new vocab, plus we do some practice AP tests. I’ve been speaking Spanish for a while and feel prepared for the AP test, but I’ve heard from others who are newer to the language that his class didn’t prepare them. However, the class itself is not hard, and he is a really nice guy.

If you took French, that was a bad decision in the first place. You might as well just forget everything that you know because he rarely tests you on past knowledge. He often goes over the same material several times and has mood swings in class. He can be funny and the whole class had a good time, but he never teaches. The homework that he assigns is never checked and he gives you a full grade if it looks like you wrote something on the paper. You can get away with not doing any of the work and still get an easy A. The tests are usually just vocabulary and as long as you are good at memorizing words you will never have to put any effort into the class.
coolest teacher EVER!! if you want an easy A take him...
Monsier Raya est tres bon, tres bien, et tres excellent!Submitted by a student
AWESOMMEEE!! he is sooo cool. just study your french and you'll be fine!

Mr. Raya is very disorganized and cluttered. Every class he takes the first 15-20 minutes to shuffle around his desk, and try to attempt to get his stuff together. I haven't learned much french from him. He is very was and almost always offers re-takes on tests. He goes off topic a lot about his experiences that don't relate to what we are learning. Most of the time we just watch movies(in english) or have cultural parties where we eat nutella.

Mr. Raya is incredibly disorganized and irresponsible. He sometime fails to complete the most basic of tasks (such as not posting homework because he "doesn't have time") and he never admits fault for anything, blaming everything from his TAs to the fact that he hasn't had his second cup of coffee. The difficulty of his exams (and sometimes even the class itself) is extremely arbitrary and depends on what mood he's in. He's so unreliable and causes so much anxiety.Submitted by a student
Best French teacher ever, as long as you study a little bit. Tests are easy, a B or an A isn't too hard to get. Very very difficult to get anything LESS than a B.
he gets off topic a lot but he knows his stuff

Chillest teacher I have ever seen. He teaches you basic French and if he messes up, he'll take fault for it. I agree that he's extremely disorganized and his tests are hard, but he's not that bad as you make him out to be.Submitted by a student

Possibly the worst french teacher of all time. When people don't understand something or do badly on his test he blames Madame Puretz, who we actually learned from. He doesn't try and help his students. He picks on people in class. The entire French department has gone to hell, incoming freshmen: DO

Awesome French teacher. If you get him 16-17, he sometimes lets you out early. It's not very hard to get an A unless you don't study at all. Not much homework. He sometimes gets mad at people for talking a lot, but usually doesn't.I would take him again if I could.

he's a very very very bad teacher. you dont learn anything. and are expected to memorize stuff for tests. always complaining about how he's been up since five at the gym, but doesnt care if u had crew practice in teh morning since 4 (just an example, he doesnt care)i speak french better than he does but hes always very condescending.he cant grade. at all. -1 question on a 50 question test becomes a 90.very hard to understand. hes the reason im not taking ap french.

I definitely regret taking french, but I am stuck with it for 2 more years. Mr. Raya is one of the worst teachers ever. He's so unorganized and barely teaches us anything. He is extremely moody and takes it out on his students. He has 7 TA's in one period which makes no sense. He always tests us on material he hasn't gone over with us in class. He always makes his test last minute. A few days before a test he will tell you he hasn't finished making yet and cant guarantee what will be on it.ughSubmitted by a student

had him for french. really easy but you don't learn a lot. he's nice and funny. our final was to do a report on a french food and make it. extremely easy A.
Very Hard! and mean too! yelled at my friend and that is totally not cool!
HE'S THE COOLEST TEACHER EVER!!!!!! it's an easy A just as long as u study for the tests
I'd probably be learning more in another french class, but Raya's alright, and not having another class to worry about is a big plus. Participate a bit in class, and you'll be good to go.
Haha, it's a lot of fun in his class... You get to hear a lot of stories...
great teacher
plays favorites, doesnt teach and gives extreemly hard tests. Better to take Maquinana or cadopi.
He's an easy A but you don't learn anything and he lets us out early. If you don't care then take him
not a very good teacher. easy though. i've been learning a lot of vocab. can't really speak a lot of sentences.

Mr. Raya is nice and the funniest teachers I know. I had him for two sememsters now & I think he has some issues since he complains about his meds a lot. Tests are usually easy. At least for me, since I usually get an A, sometimes a B. Theres hw pretty much every night but but he only looks at it just to see if u did it or not. Participation didnt count last semester but it does for this semester for some reason. Overall, he's very funny and nice but not very good at teaching.
Mr. Raya>>> Awesome
probably make u pass the exam. with a 5? who knows. spanish 5h is definitely harder than this class. does play favorites, so just get on his good side ;). somewhat chill, but inconsistent.

He is horrible at teaching and has extreemly difficult tests. Imagine Maquinana, Cadoppi or Ryland without the teachings. Currently, there are only about 2-3 As per semester. He often drops grades if he doesnt like you.
Have him for reg, super chill and doesn't get mad at us for talking loud. Also very nice and willing to clarify things for us.

I feel sorry for those hoping to learn French and instead, learn nothing and recurve a bad grade. He always "ballparks" tests, and hardly reviews or EVEN TAUGHT what we get tested on. His TAs have horrible attitudes (prob cuz of being around him) he is so unorganized. I was hoping he'd go on sabbatical next year and have a decent teacher, but no such luck. Praying that I survive one more year and finally leave this class. He also has horrible mood swings.
plays favorites but he's cool compared to the others

He's a funny guy and is a good person but recently he has been too flustered with his disorganization and multiple classes. He does play favorites but if you do work and stay on time its ok but he doesn't teach fantastically.
lol hes a funny teacher........today we were watching alladin in french in his class......lol
Monsieur Raya is the greatest French teacher Lowell High School has ever had. I can't believe he's leaving this year.Submitted by a student

If he is teaching spanish, you better take him. My choices were him Ryland, Lipman. At first I didn't know if Raya would be good, but he is amazing. Unlike Ryland, his tests are very straightforward, he is a funny guy, he almost always doesn't use the third mod of class, it is just a great experience to be in his class. Plus that means you didn't get Ryland, I cannot stress that enough.
very very nice teacher knows his stuff n hes cool. he keeps it real
